com.example.kit.data.source

Class ItemDataSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.kit.data.source.DataSource<Item,ItemSet>
      • com.example.kit.data.source.AbstractItemDataSource
        • com.example.kit.data.source.ItemDataSource

  • public class ItemDataSource
extends AbstractItemDataSource
    An interface for a database of Items, providing storage, retrieval, and deletion functionality.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ItemDataSource()
      Constructor that establishes connection to the FirestoreManager for the Tag Collection.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addData(Item newItem)
      Adds the given Item to the database if it does not exist, but an Item exists with the same ID as the given Item, that document is updated instead.
      void deleteDataByID(java.lang.String id)
      Deletes an Item from the database given its ID.
      Item getDataByID(java.lang.String id)
      Access an Item from the database cache given its ID.
      ItemSet getDataSet()
      Access the entire ItemSet of Items from the cache.

      • Methods inherited from class com.example.kit.data.source.DataSource

        setCallback

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ItemDataSource

        public ItemDataSource()
        Constructor that establishes connection to the FirestoreManager for the Tag Collection. Creates a cache for the state of the database that is updated whenever the database changes. Creates an authentication state listener that updates the collection based on the user

    • Method Detail

      • addData

        public void addData(Item newItem)
        Adds the given Item to the database if it does not exist, but an Item exists with the same ID as the given Item, that document is updated instead.
        Specified by:
        addData in class DataSource<Item,ItemSet>
        Parameters:
        newItem - The item to be added or updated in the database.

      • deleteDataByID

        public void deleteDataByID(java.lang.String id)
        Deletes an Item from the database given its ID.
        Specified by:
        deleteDataByID in class DataSource<Item,ItemSet>
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the item to be deleted.

      • getDataByID

        public Item getDataByID(java.lang.String id)
        Access an Item from the database cache given its ID.
        Specified by:
        getDataByID in class DataSource<Item,ItemSet>
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Item to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The Item associated with the given ID.

      • getDataSet

        public ItemSet getDataSet()
        Access the entire ItemSet of Items from the cache.
        Specified by:
        getDataSet in class DataSource<Item,ItemSet>
        Returns:
        ItemSet of all known Item objects.
